head.title: Firehouse Is Planned For Staten Island

hedline.hl1: Firehouse Is Planned For Staten Island

abstract.p: New York City Fire Department announces that city will build firehouse in Rossville section of Staten Island (S)

block.p: The Fire Department announced yesterday that the city would build a firehouse in the Rossville section of Staten Island, a neighborhood with the slowest response times to fire alarms in the city.

''The fire protection in the entire borough is lacking and this is the first step in addressing the problem,'' said Jerry Huntzinger, the Staten Island trustee for the Uniformed Firefighters Association, which had pushed for the firehouse.
The Fire Department announced yesterday that the city would build a firehouse in the Rossville section of Staten Island, a neighborhood with the slowest response times to fire alarms in the city.

''The fire protection in the entire borough is lacking and this is the first step in addressing the problem,'' said Jerry Huntzinger, the Staten Island trustee for the Uniformed Firefighters Association, which had pushed for the firehouse.
The borough's population has doubled in the last decade, but a new firehouse has not been built there since 1972, officials said.
The structure is to be built in Community Board 3, where the average response time is 5 minutes 59 seconds; the citywide average is 4 minutes 52 seconds.
The city has yet to select a site for the firehouse but is looking at city-owned land at Veterans Road East and Rossville Avenue.
